items.name: Object_Image
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Object_Image
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Object_Image extends ui.Object_UIElement
    ###*
    * An UI image object to display an image on screen.
    *
    * @module ui
    * @class Object_Image
    * @extends ui.Object_UIElement
    * @memberof ui
    * @constructor
    ###  
    constructor: (imageName, imageHandling) ->
        super
        
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's source rectangle on screen.
        * @property srcRect
        * @type gs.Rect
        ###
        @srcRect = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's rotation-angle in degrees. The rotation center depends on the
        * anchor-point.
        * @property angle
        * @type number
        ###
        @angle = 0
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's visual-component to display the game object on screen.
        * @property visual
        * @type gs.Component_Sprite
        ###
        @visual = new gs.Component_Sprite()
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's bitmap used for visual presentation.
        * @property bitmap
        * @type gs.Bitmap
        ###
        if imageName && imageName[0] == "$"
            @bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap(imageName)
        else    
            @bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap("Graphics/Pictures/#{imageName}")
        
        if @bitmap?
            if imageHandling == 1
                @srcRect = new Rect(0, @bitmap.height / 2, @bitmap.width, @bitmap.height / 2)
            else
                @srcRect = new Rect(0, 0, @bitmap.width || 1, @bitmap.height || 1)
            @dstRect.set(0, 0, @srcRect.width || 1, @srcRect.height || 1)
        else
            @srcRect = new Rect(0, 0, 1, 1)
            @dstRect.set(0, 0, 1, 1)
        
        @addComponent(@visual)
        
ui.Object_Image = Object_Image
